desc: Modern scientific work relies heavily on electronic circuitry and computation. This course examines the fundamentals of analog and digital electronics, explores the applications of discrete and integrated circuits, and introduces the broad topic of computer control of experiments. Students develop hands-on skills in circuit building, computer interfacing, and programming in LabView®. Students attend one laboratory period each week. Prerequisite: Physics 125 or 228. Offered alternate years.
name: Electronics
notes: Students in Physics 246 must also register for lab Physics 246 L. Closed to First-Year Students during web registration.
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Physics 125 or 228. Offered alternate years.
